job_description:
This is an opportunity to join a thriving process engineering firm serving a wide range of industries from pharmaceutical and biologics to science and technology and food and beverage.

Cheme is a team of dedicated professionals that are passionate about what we do and how we do it. Cheme is a place where you will be challenged, supported, and given the freedom and ownership to thrive. We attract the best because we continually invest in our people through career planning, training and development, and mentorship. At Cheme we know that our business is successful when our clients succeed, and our clients succeed when our people reach their potential.

Cheme Automation Engineers use their technical expertise and project management skills to solve complex automation problems, optimize industrial automation systems, and deliver projects on time and on budget for our clients. The successful candidate understands the unique challenges of both process and automation design and the importance of the interface between the two disciplines and has experience navigating a GMP regulated environment.

Cheme Automation Engineers are leaders who will lead a multi-disciplinary team on a variety of projects and provide coaching, and mentorship to younger staff.

The duties of the successful candidate will consist of a combination of the following tasks:

Management of assigned team members
Primary point of contact with clients
Project scope definition and engineering fees estimation
Preparation and maintenance of budgets and schedules
Equipment installation and cost estimating
Equipment and instrumentation selection
Control panel design and preparation of wiring diagrams
Preparation of P&ID’s and layout drawings
Execution and review of sizing calculations
Preparation of construction specifications, user requirements, functional specifications, and scope documentation
Coordination of contractors, fabricators, vendors, and progress reporting to the client
Commissioning and validation protocol preparation and review
Attendance of factory acceptance testing and on-site coordination and execution of commissioning and validation activities
Preparation and review of standard operating procedures
Travel to client sites for site review and troubleshooting

Requirements

Bachelor of Applied Science degree in engineering from a recognized Canadian university
Current registration with the Professional Engineer’s of Ontario as a licensed Professional Engineer, Engineer in Training or another equivalent provincial professional engineering registration. If registered as an engineer in training it is expected that professional practice examinations will be written and passed within 1 year.
At least 5-10 years of experience in applied automation design, engineering, and project management
Experience coordinating with fabrication shops on control panels and process skid wiring including development and review of wiring diagrams
Experience with and understanding of Ontario Electrical Code and CSA requirements for electrical systems
Experience with computer system validation practices and GAMP
Experience authoring and reviewing standard operating procedures, on-the-job trainings, and other controlled documents
Must understand the relationship between Good Manufacturing Practices, industry standards, and their application to the manufacturing process
Strong analytical skills and engineering analysis
Supervision of team members
Training and development of junior staff
Proficiency in written and spoken English with the ability to communicate clearly with clients
Adept at dealing with client’s and other people in a professional and courteous manner
Knowledge of common business practices and techniques such as quoting, preparation of requirements, marketing and sales
Use of Microsoft operating system and Microsoft Office Suite to navigate a server environment and prepare engineering documents.
Ability to use Microsoft Project to create schedules, and track project resources
Valid driver’s license, and owner of a car
At least 1 year of experience in construction/installation, equipment start-up, qualification and/or validation is mandatory

Working knowledge of at least one of the following platforms:

Allen Bradley PLC
DCS
SCADA
BMS Systems
OSISoft PI Historian
Working knowledge of PLC’s and automation in DCS platform
Working knowledge of instrumentation and control panel hardware
Working knowledge of unit operations typically used in biotech and vaccine manufacturing such as bulk manufacturing, downstream operations, formulation, sterilization (SIP), and cleaning (CIP) is not mandatory but considered a strong asset

Benefits

Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
Paid Time Off Benefits
Work From Home - Flexible hours
Training & Development
Bonus - Awards - Gifts
Employee Assistance Program - Counseling
